definition: secret inner room/bridal room
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
surname Fang
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
disturbing the privacy of bridal room (Chinese custom where guests banter with and play pranks on the newlyweds)

sentences.english: Between a night, he gets married, the nuptial chamber with her;
sentences.chinese: 一個晚上，他得到之間，洞房花燭結婚。

sentences.english: And here is the palace of Earthly Tranquillity where the emperor and the empress had to spend their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 這是坤寧宮，皇帝和皇后必須在這兒過洞房花燭夜。

sentences.english: On the bridal night, Tom stayed at Mary's house with her.
sentences.chinese: 洞房之夜，湯姆住在馬莉家與她一起。

sentences.english: A few decades ago, it was commonplace for husbands to expect to see tell-tale red marks on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 幾十年前，新郎們都希望能在洞房花燭夜見紅。

sentences.english: Perhaps under the fiery red lantern India lining roof is they tonight the nuptial chamber.
sentences.chinese: 或許火紅的燈籠印襯下的房頂就是他們今晚的洞房吧。

sentences.english: Inside, Harvey's friends played many jokes on them. Kent thought it was a lot of fun.
sentences.chinese: 哈維的朋友們在裏面鬧洞房，肯特覺得很好玩兒。

sentences.english: Bosom husband bridal chamber, hundred flatters thousand jiao red cranium.
sentences.chinese: 知心郎君洞房外，百媚千嬌紅頭蓋。

sentences.english: Do not you die, I have not registered with you and your bridal chamber into it.
sentences.chinese: 不要你死，我還沒有跟你登記和你入洞房呢。

sentences.english: Today I get married and I'm filled with joy.
sentences.chinese: 今日裏入洞房歡喜滿心。

sentences.english: What did you do on the wedding night?
sentences.chinese: 洞房花燭夜你做些什麼？

sentences.english: Bridal chamber, drunken j&js mouth constantly chanting the names of the seven sister.
sentences.chinese: 洞房中，酒醉的強生嘴裏不斷念叨七妹的名字。

sentences.english: Three point Qiu-xiang truth in love, hug into the bridal chamber.
sentences.chinese: 三點秋香真情在，春心擁抱入洞房。

sentences.english: Later in Britain, the "bawdy" custom of flinging the stocking became popular.
sentences.chinese: 後來英國人“鬧洞房”“拋長襪”的習俗變得起來。

sentences.english: Later in Britain, the "bawdy" custom of flinging the stocking" became popular.
sentences.chinese: 後來英國人“鬧洞房”“拋長襪”的習俗變得起來。

sentences.english: Night, still have some friends make chamber.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，還有些朋友鬧鬧洞房。

definition: bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地

to worship heaven and earth/ritual kneeling by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/also called 拜堂
(of a child bride) to consummate marriage
